title: Backstage at the Paris Opera's 'Nutcracker' ballet
description: The dancers of the Opéra de Paris rehearse the ballet from the version imagined by Rudolf Nureyev, showing at the Opéra Bastille from December 8 to January 1.

title: US State Department bypasses Congress and approves sale of ammunition to Israel
description: The Biden administration on Saturday OKed the sale of nearly 14,000 rounds of tank ammunition to Israel. The emergency provision invoked is rare, but not unprecedented.

title: France detains 80 in largest child sex crime swoop
description: The men arrested come from a wide range of backgrounds, they include a local councilor and two schoolteachers.

title: The strategic patience of 'Greater Israel' ideologists
description: These ideologists are betting on the long term to impose their colonial ideas. A minority of them advocate for a return to Gaza.

title: Dispute brews over auction of Asterix and Cleopatra cover
description: Sylvie Uderzo, Albert Uderzo's daughter and beneficiary, disputes the provenance of the work, estimated at between €400,000 and €500,000, and described as a 'gift' to one of her father's friends.

title: Complex trial ends with conviction of six teenagers over 2020 beheading of French teacher
description: A second trial is scheduled to take place in 2024, this time before the Paris special criminal court.

title: Does the government want Parisians to leave during the 2024 Olympic Games?
description: The French Minister of Transport has called on Parisians to 'take time off' during the Games. In other words, if they don't commute, it will make it easier for the city to accommodate the 800,000 spectators expected every day.

title: Guyana: Lula warns Maduro against 'unilateral measures'
description: Tensions over the Essequibo oil-rich region have soared since Macuro's government held a referendum in which 95% of voters supported declaring Venezuela the region's rightful owner.

title: Israel-Hamas war: Isolated United States rejects UN's call for 'immediate ceasefire'
description: With their veto in the Security Council, the Americans have buried the fifth resolution since the start of the war.

title: 3D-printed guns, a new untraceable and cheap arsenal
description: A report by the Flemish Peace Institute and the Small Arms Survey, published on December 7, warns of the emerging risk of 'homemade' weapons.

title: Sweden's 'internet priest' Charlotte Frycklund accused of betraying the Bible
description: Frycklund, a theology buff, runs the official social media accounts of the Church of Sweden, an Evangelical Lutheran church that was formerly the state church. Her regular messages of support for transgender people have provoked diverse reactions.

title: Israel-Hamas war: 'For the moment, Netanyahu strongly rejects the two-state solution'
description: The Israeli Prime Minister is not in the best of positions to oppose the American vision of 'a revitalized Palestinian Authority,' observes 'Le Monde' columnist Gilles Paris.

title: As social tensions heighten in France, Macron says he wants to restore hope in the future
description: On the sidelines of a visit to the Panthéon to choose the burial plot for resistance fighter Missak Manouchian, the French president told Le Monde that he was aware of the state of the country, fragmented and troubled by the question of identity.

title: Mahsa Amini's family prevented from leaving Iran to collect Sakharov Prize
description: According to the family's lawyer, the Aminis were banned from boarding a plane to France despite having a valid visa and their passports have been confiscated.

title: Stakes are high for Ukraine as EU leaders divided ahead of December summit
description: On December 14 and 15, the 27 member states are due to vote on the opening of accession negotiations with Kyiv and on financial and military aid to the war-torn country. For the time being, however, no compromise position is emerging.

title: COP28: Climate talks heat up after OPEC push on fossil fuels
description: OPEC Secretary General Haitham Al Ghais sent a letter to the group's 13 members and 10 Russian-led allies this week after negotiators at climate talks in Dubai released a draft deal that included calls for a phase-out of fossil fuels.

title: Joe Biden tackles 'junk fees,' the hidden charges plaguing American consumers
description: The US President is pushing for transparent pricing and protection against these fees, which are found everywhere from airlines to hotels and taxis.

title: After the killing of a teenager, a chasm opened in a French town
description: The deeply divided town of Romans-sur-Isère is reeling from the death of a 16-year-old at a party in a neighboring village, which sparked a national debate. In the deprived Monnaie neighborhood, fractures have only gotten wider in the aftermath.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: With hotels jacking up prices, authorities  promise more checks
description: Ibis hotels up to €700 a night, four-star hotels at more than €1,000: Parisian hoteliers are posting skyrocketing rates during the Olympic Games. Although it has no power to set prices, the French fraud control authority will be stepping up its checks.

title: Guatemala: Presidential election results upheld by electoral court amid coup accusations
description: Guatemalan prosecutors on Friday said investigations concluded that the elections won by Bernardo Arevalo were 'null and void', citing counting 'anomalies'. This action was labeled by the Organization of American States as an 'attempted coup.'

title: 'Julstress': Swedish parents' Christmas preparation anxiety
description: In Sweden, some people prepare weeks in advance to make sure they're ready when the festivities kick off in early December.

title: US teenager sentenced to life in prison for school shooting
description: On Friday, a judge handed a life sentence to a Michigan teenager, aged 15 at the time of the attack, for the murder of four students.

title: Ryan O'Neal, star of 'Love Story' and 'Barry Lyndon', dies at 82
description: The actor who rose from a TV soap opera to earn an Oscar nomination for 'Love Story' and showcased a charming performance alongside his 9-year-old daughter Tatum in 'Paper Moon,' passed away on Friday.

title: China welcomes Taliban ambassador without recognizing the Afghan regime
description: Beijing, which exploits a very large copper deposit in Afghanistan and shares a 47-mile border with the country, seeks to stabilize relations with the nation.
